kāmabhū： kāmabhū（pu）
ကာမဘူ（ပု）
[kāma+bhū+kvi]
[ကာမ+ဘူ+ကွိ]

Kāmabhū：A monk，evidently held in high esteem by his colleagues．

He is mentioned as staying in Kosambī，inGhosita Park，and as askingAnanda certain questions，recorded in theKāmabhū Sutta （1） （S．iv．165）．Two other suttas bearing the same name record visits paid to Kāmabhū by Cittagahapati at Ambātakavana inMacchikāsanda．S．iv．291，293．

kāmabhū：ကာမဘူ （ပု）
[ကာမ+ဘူ+ကွိ]
ကာမဘူမထေရ်။ မူရင်းကြည့်ပါ။
